subject: CS
title: Computer Security and Privacy
description: Security and privacy issues in various aspects of computing.  Specific topics include: comparing security and privacy, program security, writing secure programs, controls against program threats, operating system security, formal security models, network security, Internet application security and privacy, privacy-enhancing technologies, database security and privacy, inference data mining, security policies, physical security, economics of security, and legal and ethical issues.  (Note: Knowledge of operating systems equivalent to that obtained from CS 350 is assumed.)
